description:
Sarah Perez, TechCrunch “Automattic and Others Back Openvibe, an App That’s Unifying the Open Social Web”:

Launched in 2024, Openvibe initially supported three of the more prominent open social networks, all of which operate using different protocols: Mastodon uses ActivityPub, Bluesky runs on AT Protocol, and Nostr powers a number of third-party apps. Openvibe later added support for Instagram Threads, as that app became further integrated with ActivityPub and opened itself up to the developer community.

As CEO Matej Svancer explained at the time, the idea behind his app was to offer users a more friendly a
title: ★ Openvibe, a Multi-Social-Network App for Bluesky, Mastodon, Threads (Supposedly), and Nostr

description:
Chance Miller at 9to5Mac has a good rundown of everything new in iOS 18.3, and his colleague Ryan Christoffel has a similar rundown for MacOS 15.3 all-five-vowels Sequoia. (See also: Michael Tsai.)

 ★
title: iOS 18.3 and MacOS 15.3 Are Both Out

description:
Jim Acosta, signing off from CNN for the final time:

It is never a good time to bow down to a tyrant. I believe it is the job of the press to hold power to account — I’ve always tried to do that here at CNN, and I plan on doing all of that again in the future.

One final message: Don’t give in to the lies. Don’t give in to the fear. Hold on to the truth, and hope.

President Trump, gloating on his very popular social network, Truth Social (current ranking the App Store: not in the top 200 free downloads, #20 in Social Networking):

Wow, really good news! Jim Acosta, one of the worst and most dishonest reporters in journalistic history, a major sleazebag, has been relegated by CNN Fake News to the Midnight hour, “Death Valley,” because of ex
title: Jim Acosta, Reporter and Anchor Despised by Trump, Leaves CNN

description:
MG Siegler, writing at Spyglass:

Anyway, this matters because it doesn’t mean that DeepSeek, an app based off of the Chinese-developed AI model of the same name, is the most popular app ever despite its current place atop the charts. Your mom probably isn’t downloading it. Just as last week, your mom probably wasn’t downloading Xiaohongshu (‘Little Red Book’), incidentally another Chinese app that rose to the top of the charts. But it is still interesting because again, the mainstays have in recent years dominated these charts. Sure, new entrants would rise (and fall) from time-to-time but it was almost always some order of: Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Threads, TikTok, CapCut, YouTube, Gmail, Google Map
title: Shakeup in the App Store Top Downloads List
